jannah.description: Paradise will have lush gardens with flowing rivers of water, milk, honey, and wine.

jannah.feature: Rivers of milk, honey, wine, and pure water
jannah.description: Unlike worldly drinks, these will not spoil or intoxicate.
Believers will have purified companions free from worldly flaws.
All inhabitants of Jannah will be eternally young, around the age of 33.
Paradise removes all human weaknesses, including death.
Angels will welcome the believers with greetings of peace.
Allah will remove all rancor from their hearts.

jannah.feature: Palaces made of gold and silver
jannah.description: Believers will dwell in palaces adorned with unimaginable beauty.

jannah.feature: Silken garments and bracelets of gold
jannah.description: Inhabitants will wear garments of fine silk and ornaments.
Families will recline together on adorned couches.
They will have whatever they desire, forever.
Fruits of every kind will be available in abundance.
Believers will drink from cups filled with pure sealed nectar.
Believers will be with the Prophets, martyrs, and righteous.
Each tent will be made of hollow pearls, vast and radiant.
Allah said: 'I have prepared for My righteous servants what no eye has seen, no ear has heard, and no heart has imagined.'
The greatest blessing of Jannah will be gazing upon the face of Allah.
All past sorrow and trials will be erased.
Paradise has levels, the highest being Al-Firdaws.
Servants will provide them with whatever they desire, in complete satisfaction.

hell.feature: Fire fueled by men and stones
hell.description: Hellfire will be kindled with humans and stones as fuel.
Hell has seven gates, each for a portion of sinners.
The inhabitants will drink scalding water tearing apart their insides.
Garments of molten copper will burn their bodies.
Disbelievers will be bound with heavy chains.
Nineteen stern angels guard Hell, carrying out Allah’s punishment.
Inhabitants will eat from the tree of Zaqqum which boils in their stomachs.

hell.feature: Dark smoke and shade of fire
hell.description: Instead of cool shade, they will be covered with burning smoke.
The damned will beg to return to life, but will be denied.
Each time their skin burns off, Allah replaces it so they feel the punishment again.
The fire of Hell is constantly blazing.
They will neither have cool drink nor nourishing food.
Disbelievers’ faces will be covered in gloom and disgrace.
They will be thrown into a narrow place in chains, utterly crushed.
The dwellers will scream and wail endlessly.
The fire of Hell is seventy times more intense than worldly fire.
They will neither die nor will the punishment lighten.
The punishment of Hell differs based on sins; the least is wearing shoes of fire boiling the brain.
Inhabitants will despair of any relief.
The greatest punishment is being veiled from seeing Allah.
